triples.name: Consensus decision-making
triples.relevance: The paper addresses consensus reaching as a core decision-making approach in group settings.

triples.name: Group decision-making
triples.relevance: Large-scale group decision-making is the primary problem domain that the paper addresses.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus dynamics models opinion convergence in networks, which is fundamental to the proposed CRP approach.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: The paper uses social network analysis to determine expert weights and relationships in the decision-making process.

triples.name: Taxicab geometry
triples.relevance: Manhattan distance (a metric in taxicab geometry) is used to measure opinion differences between experts.

triples.name: Feedback
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a feedback mechanism to adjust expert opinions dynamically during the consensus reaching process.

triples.name: Louvain method
triples.relevance: The fast unfolding algorithm (Louvain method) is used to reduce the dimensionality of large-scale group data.
